Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy when it has water and light, with some recognizable features of a growing plant such as green leaves and a sturdy stem.
The student can depict a plant without water by showing drooping or wilted leaves, although there might be inconsistencies in showing other effects such as discoloration.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately depict a plant without light, possibly showing incorrect features such as drooping leaves instead of yellowing or elongated stem characteristics (student confuses effects of water and light).

The student is unlikely to correctly show a comparison between healthy and resource-deprived plants, potentially mixing up the signs of lack (student may attempt comparison but only partially succeeds or incorrectly matches symptoms to causes).
